label: PTX188 | Amoxicillin
moa_drugbank: Amoxicillin competitively inhibits penicillin-binding protein 1 and other high molecular weight penicillin binding proteins.[A6205,A190678]  Penicillin bind proteins are responsible for glycosyltransferase and transpeptidase reactions that lead to cross-linking of D-alanine and D-aspartic acid in bacterial cell walls.[A190678] Without the action of penicillin binding proteins, bacteria upregulate autolytic enzymes and are unable to build and repair the cell wall, leading to bacteriocidal action.[A190642,A190678]
protein_binding: Amoxicillin is 17% protein bound in serum.[A190627]
